page.title: 15Pubs and Tearooms: FINTRY
page.content:
Both our pubs started out as "drovers' rests". Both provide bar snacks, regular entertainmment and have all day, seven day licenses. { {The Clachan Hotel} built around 1750, has two bars, a dining room, large beer garden and four letting bedrooms. { {The Fintry Inn,}first licensed in 1805 has two bars, dining room, small beer garden and can offer over-night stay.
There is also tearoom, run alongside other activities.{The Coffee Shop}is Nancy's tearoom to people in Fintry. Open all year from 10-5pm. The menu is seasonal from hot soup to cream teas. The accent is very much on home-baking and homely atmosphere. There are facilities for the disabled.
